title: NineLeaf 2PK 15Amp Single Pole Rocker Interrupter Decorative Light Switches, 120-277V, Decorator Paddle Rocker Switch (UL Listed, White)

product_information.Best Sellers Rank: Best Sellers Rank:  #148,850 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)    #460 in Electrical Light Switches       #460 in Electrical Light Switches

shipping_info: FREE Wednesday, June 11 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
product_category: Tools & Home Improvement›Electrical›Switches & Dimmers›Wall Switches›Light Switches
feature_bullets: 【Single Pole Light Switch】Single pole wall light switch, Rating(A,V): 15 Amp, 60 Hz, 120-277V, Product Size:4.17x1.42x1.42" (106x36.2x36.2mm),UL & CUL listed.
【High Quality】Sturdy construction made of high-quality, impact resistant polycarbonate thermoplastic and solid steel for extended service life.
【Self-Grounding】Designed with a self-grounding clip for automatic connection in a properly grounded metal wall box.

【Easy Installation】Provide both quick push-in wiring and side wiring. Quick wiring push-in terminals accept #14AWG solid copper wire only. Side wiring terminal screws accept wire up to #12AWG copper or copper-clad wire. Break-off plaster ear for best flush alignment. Shallow body design fits standard junction boxes.
【Universal Application】Suitable for residential use and most commercial areas that require only 15A switches. Repair or Replace old or broken rocker switches in your bedroom, kitchen or work space.

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2025
Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2020
customer_reviews.review_snippet: These work great and simple to change

customer_reviews.rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars5.0 out of 5 stars
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet: I like the paddle light switch because it’s more modern looking than the rocker types. These were easy to install if you know basic wiring. They are single pole so you control one light from one location.

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: I bought these for two lights and had an electrician install them. The dimmers barely dimmed the lights. After a short while (within an hour), it didn’t even dim - I would move the dimmer and there was not even the slightest dimmer. The instructs said to adjust the micro adjustment dial if it doesn’t dim properly. My electrician tried to do that a the circuit shorted. So he installed his recommended Lutron dimmer and wow that actually worked and dimmed all the way down to zero light. I can’t even return this junk since one destroyed. Save your money and go with a known brand which may be a little more expensive but totally worth it.

customer_reviews.review_title: 2.0 out of 5 starsProblems with fulcrum / pivot point on switch
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Poor quality product. Purchased 4 switches, on one the center "rocker pin" broke after about one month, which resulted in the switch no longer working, while on others, switch does not completely move sufficiently to "on position" through normal pressure on top portion of switch to power on light - rocker falls about eighth of an inch short of contact point, necessitating a second push to fully engage. When new, switch works well, but after 1-2 months, rocker switch starts to malfunction. I have replaced these switches with better quality ones costing a couple of dollars more each.

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet: I bought these because I needed one for replacing my kitchen switch. It was easy to install and works great and I have a back up as needed.

customer_reviews.rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars5.0 out of 5 stars
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet: These are good quality switches. The plastic and metal they're made of are not flimsy and the build quality is good - nothing rough or dinged or anything.Each switch is individually packaged. There are no covers but that's not a problem - makes it easier to use in multi-gang boxes.You can use either push-in or screw-type connections (the push-in looks to be limited to 14ga wire). Otherwise it's a basic outlet - nothing too exciting.

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: I bought two, 2-packs of these and have now had to return both packs.  They install easily, but within a couple days, the dimmer function no longer worked even though the switch itself still did.  The first 2-pack went bad within a couple days and the second took a few days longer.  I should have known to not buy a name-brand electrical product.  I highly recommend NOT buying these!
